description: [Premium Times] The President of Found Foundation, Darren Walker, said the majority of young people in Africa endorse military interventions if democratically elected leaders fail to deliver on their promises.
title: Africa: Why Young Africans Are Endorsing Military Interventions - Ford Foundation President

description: [African Union] The African Union Economic, Social and Cultural Council (AU-ECOSOCC) Secretariat, in collaboration with the Government of Zambia, officially hosted a Flag Raising Ceremony on July 4th, 2024, at the ECOSOCC Secretariat in Lusaka, Zambia. This significant event officially marked the commencement of the #ECOSOCC20 flagship commemorations, celebrating 20 years of ECOSOCC's impactful journey towards African unity and enhanced citizen participation in continental affairs.
title: Africa: Ecosocc Secretariat and the Government of Zambia Host Flag Raising Ceremony Marking the Start of #ecosocc20 Commemorations

description: [African Union] The Ministerial Session of the 7th African Union Specialized Technical Committee (STC) on Finance, Monetary Affairs, Economic Planning and Integration kicked off on 6th July 2024, under the theme "Enhancing Macroeconomic and sectoral policies coordination in Africa: challenges, opportunities and policy priorities for inclusive growth and sustainable development", in Tunis, the Republic of Tunisia.
title: Africa: Enhancing Macroeconomic Policies Pave the Way for a Prosperous Future for the Continent

description: [Afropop] The Colombian alternative act Meridian Brother, is a one-man-band in the recording studio, and a five-piece ensemble on stage. The one man in question is Eblis Álvarez, a veteran of Bogota's underground music scene since 1998. The most recent in a string of conceptual Meridian Brothers releases, Meridian Brothers &amp; El Grupo Renacimiento, traced the trajectory of "an invented veteran salsa band being reborn in a compromised state, questioning our obsession with truth and lies, illusion and
title: Africa: Meridian Brothers Turn to Africa On Mi Latinoamérica Sufre

description: [UN News] The international community must urgently summon the commitment and investments needed to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by the 2030 deadline, the UN Deputy Secretary-General stressed on Monday.
title: Africa: UN Deputy Chief Demands Bold Policies, Innovative Solutions for SDGs

description: [The Conversation Africa] In March 2002, the Larsen B Ice Shelf collapsed catastrophically, breaking up an area about one-sixth the size of Tasmania.
title: Africa: We Used 1,000 Historical Photos to Reconstruct Antarctic Glaciers Before a Dramatic Collapse

description: [The Conversation Africa] Since the release of ChatGPT in November 2022, the world has seen an incredible surge in investment, development and use of artificial intelligence (AI) applications. According to one estimate, the amount of computational power used for AI is doubling roughly every 100 days.
title: Africa: Power-Hungry AI Is Driving a Surge in Tech Giant Carbon Emissions. Nobody Knows What to Do About It

description: [UN News] Last month was the hottest June since records began and the thirteenth month in a row to set a temperature record, according to new data released on Monday from the European Union's Copernicus Climate Change Service.
title: Africa: Earth's Hottest June On Record

description: [Foroyaa] According to a report published by the International Organization for Migration (IOM), 7.9 million people in West and Central Africa (WCA), were internally displaced due to conflict and violence in 2023.
title: Africa: IOM Report Says 7.9 Million People Internally Displaced in 2023

description: [ACSS] Despite limited enforcement capacity, the African Court provides an avenue for redress when national judiciaries are unable to dispense justice, underscoring its instrumental role in promoting norms and standards of conduct on the continent.
title: Africa: Why the African Court On Human and Peoples' Rights Matters

description: [Independent (Kampala)] Trade between Africa and the Caribbean could soar to $1.8 billion annually by 2028, provided that value addition, trade facilitation, and enhanced logistics are prioritized, according to new research from the International Trade Centre (ITC) and the African Export-Import Bank Currently, bilateral trade in goods between the two regions stands at $729 million.
title: Africa: Africa-Caribbean Trade Poised to Hit $1.8 Billion By 2028

description: [HRW] Media headlines are full of bad news about LGBTQ+ people across the African continent these days. They are insulted by public officials, attacked and killed by police and vigilantes, and denied access to justice and dignity. Often, these negative words and actions are justified as being part and parcel of "African values."
title: Africa: We Need to Reclaim Pan-Africanism Through Love--for Everyone

description: [IPS] Kathmandu, Nepal -- A High-Level Political Forum - described as one of the most important events of the year for discussing the implementation of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)--will take place at the United Nations through July 18.
title: Africa: A New Treaty for a Sustainable and Just Future?

description: [The Conversation Africa] Southern Africa's wildlife economy is often hailed as a successful model. The idea behind this model is that biodiversity and wildlife are used as the basis of sustainable economic growth, through an increase in wildlife numbers and in a country's revenue.
title: Southern Africa: Southern Africa Is Seen As a Leader in Wildlife Conservation, but Its Market-Driven Approach Is Deeply Flawed
